website_summaries.verdict: The Epson Home Cinema 2040 3D 1080p 3LCD Projector delivers high-quality 2D and 3D, a short lag time for gaming, and a bright enough image to stand up to ambient light in a family room.
pros: Short lag time and near-excellent image quality for 2D and 3D in testing

customer_reviews.title: Bringing the Movie Theater to Your Home!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I was worried that a 1080p image would look poor when projected at 100". This projector proved me wrong! After I booted it up, I was blown away by how vibrant and crisp the image looked. After using this, I don't think I'll watch on anything smaller than 100". I also have a 50" 4k TV (without HDR), and I would still rather watch a movie using the 1080p projector. I took some pictures that will give you a good idea of what it looks like. Note that the pictures do not show the true scale of the projection. In person it looks huge!
customer_reviews.author: Tess Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying having the image size of a projector, such a step up from the 60" TV. Currently have it set up with a 120" screen. I'm really impressed with the image quality, but only use it in the dark, so I can't comment on the performance in normally or even dim lit rooms. Also only using it for movies, even though I'm a casual gamer. The fan is a bit noisier than I'd like, but when watching a movie I don't notice it except during quiet parts. It's also currently just sitting on a table behind the viewer temporarily till it's ceiling mounted. So I don't expect it to be a an issue at that point.
customer_reviews.author: The Sixth

customer_reviews.title: It's great but definitely needs some improvement with picture processing
customer_reviews.text: Colors are rich even on eco setting and there is no "Rainbow effect (RBC)". It's great but definitely needs some improvement with picture processing. On fast scenes, obvious pixelation shows up akin to lower resolution pixelation like how Minecraft looks like. It's not that the entire image pixelates but just some details/highlights in the whole picture shows obvious pixelation. I suspect the hardware or software does this to keep up with the fast scenes. Still this would be a great purchase given the $79 replacement lamps. Compared to a BENQ 1075, the pixels of the Epson 2040 are bigger and so the screen door effect is obvious when one is up close to the screen (1-2 feet).
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great 3LCD projector.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was one of the only projectors out there with horizontal AND vertical keystoning. Currently using it at an angle, and it looks great. Was worried about getting a 3LCD over a DLP, but the brightness and clarity of the projection are pretty decent, even with a semi-lit room. Utilizes CEC as well, which was a bonus. Would definitely recommend as a mid-range projector. Only thing I would suggest is turning off the frame interpolation, at least when playing games. It creates a lot of ghosting effects. And, I wouldn't use the speakers on this thing; get dedicated speakers for better audio range.
customer_reviews.author: Nate A.

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for Little Bucks
customer_reviews.text: A great projector for a great price, this is perfect for family movie nights. Not having any room in my house for a permanent theater, this projector is a breeze to set-up on the fly against a screen or wall. The built in speaker has no bass to it but it is not bad all things considering (speakers or a sound bar does improve the experience). One note: the project automatically comes with the frame smoothing feature already set. This gives the image that dreaded "soap opera" effect but can be deactivated easily (I recommend doing this).
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. I questioned whether I should get this or another projector with a higher lumen count, but I'm glad I went for this one. It has several brightness levels and is plenty bright enough to play in the afternoon , in our house. The 3D in this projector is amazing (purchase glasses separately). All in all I have no complaints with my 120+ inch new viewing area!
customer_reviews.author: Drew H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. THIS.
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this projector. Got it used from Amazon for $520 and it was one of the best purchases I've ever made. I love this thing. Occasional hiccup in picture stream, but it resolves after a few minutes and doesn't return. Doesn't happen with every use and became more infrequent after the first 4 uses.
customer_reviews.author: CIreland

customer_reviews.title: ... in my life Trust me guys this product is amazing and I love it here is in short good ...
customer_reviews.text: It took couple of minutes for me to navigate link on my mobile to review this product which means this is my first ever review in my life Trust me guys this product is amazing and I love it here is in short good and bad about this product The good 1. Picture perfect 2. As described all features 3. Brightness 4. Price 5. Main - maintenance cost ex lamp cost The bad 1. Speakers - it can be better 2. Throw distance - it is good but I guess 2feet more then described Overall I used it only fora day and I can confidently recommend it ... will update this after couple of weeks
customer_reviews.author: Achyuth

customer_reviews.title: Good projector for the price, but...
customer_reviews.text: 1. Satisfied, to a degree, with the purchase of this projector. 2. Im giving this product 3 stars based on 2 issues. 3. The first issue I've seen is the brightness correction. When the system switches from a bright scene, to a darker aspect, the projector has a tendency to dim out, as it slowly corrects to the appropriate brightness level. 4. @12'10" the max screen size projection is 10'3". As advertised you can get 134"@ 12' From what I'm seeing, the given projector dimensions, are slightly off . In my living room it currently projects at 9'1" wide from 12'10, elevated @3'10".
customer_reviews.author: vern

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry leaves projector for home entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This is my first projector at home for entertainment and I love it. I have a 100" screen, a blue ray player and a good sound system connected to it. It is great for watching movies and play games on. it has pretty good definition and is very bright. On the down side it is light on features and the fan is quite loud. I have the impression this projector was originally designed for office presentations and is just now being marketed for home entertainment. There are nicer models out there with much bigger price tags, but the quality/value on this one is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great projector still - after 4 years running...
customer_reviews.text: We always find that epson products just work and work. No difference on this projector. 4 years and on the 3 bulb, it just keeps wowing. Colors pop, black is black, no rainbow. This projector can keep up with fast action movies without skipping a beat. It is not as crisp as a 4K, or course, but for high end every day and videophiles, it is a reliable workhorse that doesnt let you down.
customer_reviews.author: nathan vignola

customer_reviews.title: Screen shape adjustment is very very difficult to make it correct
customer_reviews.text: I really do not understand why Epson made this model too difficult to shape the correct screen shape. It looks almost impossible to adjust the Keystone correctly which I have never experienced with other branded projectors before even including other Epson Models. Why in the world why ?????? I'd rather recommend personally Optoma HD29Darbee 1080p 3200 Lumens 3D DLP Home Theater Projector in similar price level.
customer_reviews.author: A Movie Lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had a 720p LCD projector, but it was old, and the lamp was dying. This is a welcome upgrade. Bright enough I can use it in the daytime (it's 2x as bright as my previous projector). 1080 is noticeably better than 720. If you notice rainbows with DLP projectors, I highly recommend this one as an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: TimTheEnchanter

customer_reviews.title: Very good projector for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage son, who is really into home theater. It's been 1 year and probably runs 2-4hrs per day, sometimes longer (and continuously) without issues. He uses it for video games, and TivoMini, no issues. For the money, the picture looks very good (and this is when projected on an off-white wall w/ flat-paint finish). The first time he cranked it up w/ some weather channel footage, I was amazed by the picture. I can only image how awesome it would look w/ a real screen. His room tends to get stuffy and it seems to do ok (ie, no overheating). I'd say the fan also generates average noise.. very happy
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice when it worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very upsetting. The lamp light came on after maybe 20 hours of use. I call customer service and because I could not get it to duplicate they could not help me. The problem went away letting it sit but I ordered a brand new lamp on my on and it work for maybe 5 hours over a couple days of normal use and is doing the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: The best in the price range. Gamers dream!!
customer_reviews.text: First off i dont really do reviews much but im gonna put this plain and simple. Money cant buy better in this price bracket, especially if your a gamer. Input lag is very low. I do not notice it playing fallout 4 in FP. I tried the hp 37 and optoma hd28dse. The Epson 2040 trumped them both in picture quality, clarity, brightness, and blacks. The setup is very user friendly also which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The color output is the best for the price
customer_reviews.text: The hype is real! The color output is the best for the price. Indirect lighting has little to no effect on the picture quality. The 2040 has nominal noise output so it doesn't interfere with your theater experience. The picture quality is excellent with little delay time.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the picture. We have been using for about 8 months now and definitely worth the money. We have it in a dark basement where there is little light so it really looks good. Compared to my 4K LG OLED Tv, the picture is not so good but, we shouldn't expect 4K quality picture from this projector though (as it's not).
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Good machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy setup. Bought for non-profit recreation center and works great. Good picture quality. Only issue with setup is no wifi so had to go home download software onto thumb drive and then go back and upload into machine. Would have been nice to know that was how updates happen in advance. Been using since October.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We chose this projector because it was rated great for the price without having to spend upwards of $2000 for one. So far, it is working great! The picture quality is clear even just on the wall without our screen up yet. The fan is kind of loud but not as bad as some people said it was and it's even quieter on eco mode. We bought a mounting kit for it and it was easy to mount. We are pleased with our purchase and look forward to many movie nights!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No a bad projector
customer_reviews.text: Brought this 2040 on black Friday I was driven by price... And the picture is okay at best... But after installing it.. It has a mind of its own and will cut off without warning so buyers do your homework and reading of known issues.... I am revising my first post as it may in fact be human error
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wendal

customer_reviews.title: The iris action is kind of annoying and honestly it doesn't make enough of a difference ...
customer_reviews.text: A decent upgrade from my acer 720p projector. The contrast is exceptional even with auto iris disabled. The iris action is kind of annoying and honestly it doesn't make enough of a difference to be left on. Decently quiet unit and the image quality is great. There is a manual horizontal and automatic vertical adjustment (my acer only had vertical) which made placement significantly easier. Motion interpolation works well but has hiccups on 24 fps content.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Short

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality, 3D decent, value is the price. Drawback, nonstop auto iris errors started 2 months into ownership. Google it, seems its an Epson quirk that they dont care to remedy, will mot be buying Epson for next replacement, going back to Optoma for more money but last one lasted me 9 years and 3 bubls without ANY error! Research before you buy: make it your motto.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This projector has been awesome. We bought it about 2 months ago and ...
customer_reviews.text: This projector has been awesome. We bought it about 2 months ago and use it daily. It shoots a crisp picture out at a very large size. The best part is that on the "eco" mode it is super quiet. In a mostly blacked out room it's fine on eco, if you had tons of light in the room it would need to be on full blast to see.
customer_reviews.author: A. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful picture. A bit noisy if you leave the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful picture. A bit noisy if you leave the auto-iris turned on, so try to find a place where it isn't right behind you. I am using a home built screen consisting of a wood frame, and white black-out cloth. Picture is amazing on it. I don't have any projectors to compare it to, so I will say that both games and movies look decent, with only minor adjustments. I thought contrast was going to be an issue, but it doesn't seem to be in my setting. I do have fairly decent light control, and leave it in ECO mode.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I've ever done. Set up in a 12x8 room suspended from the ceiling about 8ft from the wall. Makes a 90 inch screen which is most comfortable for the room. Really easy to use and the most economical. No need to get the wifi enabled version because it takes my roku no problem. I absolutely love this thing. Also of note, replacement bulbs for these are cheaper than on other projectors.
customer_reviews.author: Another Jones

customer_reviews.title: and great for any living room situation that wants to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Having spent months researching projectors, I settled on this one and have not regretted it. Bright, fast, and great for any living room situation that wants to have more fun on movie nights! NOTE: I also game a bit, and the lag on the projector is nearly doesn't exist. From my experience and research, I believe the input lag on this projector is one of the best in the industry (as of this review).
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Projector not able to hold its own weight
customer_reviews.text: It was hanging well from the ceiling for about 1.5 - 2 years... I found the pictures moving slowly up on the wall. When I checked the projector I see that one of the arms holding the projector is broken taking the plastic out from the projector. There are cracks where the other two arms hold the projector. 3 review points because the projector itself is good but it couldn't sustain its own weight and the Epson support will send a replacement after I requested for exceptional approval for the same. Hope the replacement doesn't come up with any problems
customer_reviews.author: asish pradhan

customer_reviews.title: OK but it developed issues after nominal usage
customer_reviews.text: The projector was easy to install and worked well, especially considering the price point in the low $600s. BUT a blue triangle formed after about 2,000 hours and Epson customer service indicated this needed to be brought to a service expert. It is a common issue with the optical lens, but it doesn’t make sense to spend $200+ to service this lower priced unit. This is a common defect that Epson should fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture as if youre watching a big flatscreen

This projector did not dissapoint. Grreat for gaming and watching regular tv as well. Would recommend for anyone thinking about buying a projector to replace their existing tv.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture quality

customer_reviews.title: Good projector overall

As the unit heats up it goes out of focus more. Cant tell when watching movies, only when trying to read text on screen. Brightness is not uniform, but this seems to affect all projectors.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price and great quality. We use this in our home for entertainment. The picture is clear and easily visible with the curtains open and inside lights on. The speaker isn't very loud or clear, sounds muffled when the volume is turned up. We had to use external speakers for the sound. I would have given it 5 stars if the speakers sounded better and the volume went higher.
customer_reviews.author: Olayan, D

customer_reviews.title: Pictures quality out performs much more expensive projectors!
customer_reviews.text: I did extensive research far and wide. I had purchased a more expensive projector and had to return it because of the screen door effect. I settled on this one because of the price and reviews and I’m glad I did. The picture is super crisp and everyone is jealous of how huge my “TV” is and they want to know where I got it.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!

Beautiful detailed bright picture with nice color balance. Just super pleased and impressed! Only nitpicks would be a terrible loudspeaker (I use 5.1 setup so not an issue), a fan you can hear (not really an issue) and a black power cord for a white projector.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector for a smallish HT room

Note, I'm not a video expert and was nervous going the projector route, but now happy with large screen that I couldn't get economically with a TV. I really like how well it does with my XBOX One console - no lag or weird visual anomalies.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!!
customer_reviews.text: We only have been using this for about a week, but we love it so far! The picture is crisp for movies and gaming. My son plays xbox 360 madden 16 and we have it run through the projector- he loves it and there is no delay. It is exactly what we wanted at a reasonable price. Note: you will want additional speakers for better sound even though the projector has a speaker.

customer_reviews.title: Great projector, good brightness
customer_reviews.text: Great projector, good brightness, however you can hear some adjusting sounds when you move a mouse or something moves in the video game. Kinda strange but works well.

customer_reviews.title: Loved this product

customer_reviews.title: It's almost "too white"- but still looks great. First thing I did was turn off all ...

It's almost "too white"- but still looks great. First thing I did was turn off all those "fake" looking additive settings. If you don't calibrate your projector, youre doing yourself a disservice.

customer_reviews.title: We just got it and so far it's been awesome! Extremely easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We just got it and so far it's been awesome! Extremely easy to set up. We have a screen that is 4 feet tall and 7 feet wide and the projector has to be exactly 10 feet away to completely fill the screen. The fan is quiet and the color and brightness are wonderful. I love that it has a remote.

customer_reviews.title: The color and clarity is beautiful. I expected nothing less from an Epson
customer_reviews.text: The color and clarity is beautiful. I expected nothing less from an Epson. First time projector buyer and I couldn't be happier. I thought and expected that I would need total darkness for a picture that I would enjoy and it's just not the case. I am able to have a floor lamp on and the quality of the image still looks amazing. I use this as my main monitor for my Macbook Pro for video editing. No more looking at a small screen for my countless hours of editing. :)

customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my projector. It has been so dependable and the quality is top-notch. I don't care to get a TV after owning this projector.

customer_reviews.text: Not much more to say here than the picture quality is absolutely amazing, even on a 135" display (haven't tried more, I'm sure it looks just as great) and it's quiet. Everyone I've invited over for outdoor movie night has run out to buy one of their own.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, easy to use.

I would highly recommend this to anyone that wants a home theater projector on a budget. Projector has a lot of goodies that the more expensive projectors have. Very nice LCD projector! Thank you Epson!!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cinema projector for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cinema projector that gives you a 100" screen for the cost of a 50" TV! Great contrast, very sharp, and the 3D is just like in the theaters. Highly recommend!

customer_reviews.text: After 2+ years still going good. We use it in our bedroom and have been using it every night from last 2 years. The picture quality is so good and the colors are still very real. The price of this product keeps changing so wait for a good deal.

customer_reviews.title: Bright, beautiful picture. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Great for a theater room
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up out of the box. Great image quality for a projector at this price. Did lots of reviews on a ton of projectors and am happy to say this one doesn't disappoint. Have it in a new theater room in the basement against a 100 in screen and the picture is so clear. So far amazing quality. Much clearer than even our new 50 in sony lcd tv.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!

customer_reviews.text: Works well, good 3D image, working with my Samsung 3D glasses. It's a bit noisy, but not a complaint for such a good price.

customer_reviews.text: Bang for your buck, this projector is awesome. I paid $499 for this LCD, 1080P, 3D project to replace a 720P projector I paid 8x as much for 10 years ago. Blu-ray, video games, live TV all look great. The only problem isn't an issue with the projector, but with streaming services such as Netflix or HBO Go. Their compression doesn't stand up to the picture quality the projector puts out, often looking grainy at 110 inches.

product_meta.title: Epson Home Cinema 2040 1080p 3D 3LCD Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: The Home Cinema 2040 projector brings the big screen home, delivering Full HD 1080p entertainment. This portable performer delivers up to 35,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio, advanced image processing, plus 2200 lumens of color brightness and 2200 lumens of white brightness (2). Enjoy movies, games and more with two HDMI ports and MHL (3) connectivity. Connect your Blu-ray Disc player, gaming console or streaming device, and project up to 300" virtually anywhere. A built-in speaker and convenient setup tools mean you can enjoy HD content out of the box.
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 90-inches from 8 feet; 134-inches from 12 feet. Projector Dimensions: Including feet - 11.69" x 9.65" x 4.69" (W x D x H). Excluding feet - 11.69" x 9.80" x 4.49" (W x D x H).
White Brightness: 2200 Lumens; Color Brightness: 2200 Lumens
Contrast Ratio: 35,000:1; Keystone Correction: Yes; Lens Shift: No
Warranty: 2 Year Limited; Lamp Life: Up to 7,500 hours (ECO mode) and up to 4000 hours (Normal mode)
Connectivity: 2 HDMI (1 MHL), 1 RCA (composite), 2 RCA (1 audio L/R) stereo, 1 VGA D-sub 15 pin (computer input), 1 USB Type A. Please refer the User Guide before use.
